definition:
Let $(X,\mathcal{A},\mu)$ be a measure space and
$f \colon X \to \mathbb{K}$ a measurable function. Then
$M_f \colon \phi \mapsto f \phi$ is the multiplication operator with $f$
defined on the subspace
$Dom(M_f)=\{\phi \in L^2_\mathbb{K}(X,\mathcal{A},\mu) \colon f \phi \in L^2_\mathbb{K}(X,\mathcal{A},\mu)\}$.
It plays an important role in quantum mechanics where the multiplication
with the coordinates on $\mathbb{R}^n$ is the position operator.
